questions.text: If glycogen is used for anaerobic glycolysis in muscle, there is net gain of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 3 ATP

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The net gain of ATP in anaerobic glycolysis when glycogen is the substrate is 3 ATP , due to the bypassing of the ATP-consuming step in the breakdown of glycogen.
  • ➤ 3 ATP

questions.text: The hormones, epinephrine and glucagon have which one of the following effects on glycogen metabolism in the liver?

options.label: A
options.text: The net synthesis of glycogen is increased.

options.label: B
options.text: Glycogen phosphorylase is phosphorylated and active, whereas glycogen synthase is phosphorylated and inactive.

options.label: C
options.text: Both glycogen phosphorylase and glycogen synthase are activated by phosphorylation but at significantly different rates.

options.label: D
options.text: cAMP-dependent protein kinase A is activated, whereas phosphorylase kinase is inactivated.

questions.correct_answer: B. Glycogen phosphorylase is phosphorylated and active, whereas glycogen synthase is phosphorylated and inactive.
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Glycogen phosphorylase is phosphorylated and active, whereas glycogen synthase is phosphorylated and inactive.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epinephrine and glucagon cause phosphorylation, activating glycogen phosphorylase (for glycogen breakdown) and inactivating glycogen synthase (preventing glycogen synthesis).
  • ➤ glycogen phosphorylase
  • ➤ glycogen synthase

questions.text: Which of the following is false about electron transport chain?

options.label: A
options.text: There is no production of ATP at complex 2 as it does not translocate H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space

options.label: B
options.text: Complex 1, translocate 4 H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space

options.label: C
options.text: Complex 3, translocate 3 H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space

options.label: D
options.text: Complex 4, translocate 2 H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space

questions.correct_answer: C. Complex 3, translocate 3 H ion from mit. Matrix to intermembranous space
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Complex 3 translocates 3 H ions from mitochondrial matrix to intermembranous space.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Complex 3 translocates 4 H ions , not 3, from the mitochondrial matrix to the intermembranous space.
  • ➤ Complex 3
  • ➤ 4 H ions

questions.text: ADP to ATP transfer in mitochondria is affected by?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Oligomycin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Oligomycin specifically inhibits ADP to ATP conversion by blocking ATP synthase (Complex V), which is essential for ATP production.
  • ➤ Oligomycin

questions.text: Mature RBC contains all except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Succinate dehydrogenase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mature RBCs lack succinate dehydrogenase because they have no mitochondria.
  • ➤ succinate dehydrogenase

questions.text: TIGAR
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) All of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ TIGAR is involved in regulating glycolysis and apoptosis , and it is structurally related to fructose-2,6-bisphosphatase .
  • ➤ TIGAR
  • ➤ glycolysis
  • ➤ apoptosis
  • ➤ fructose-2,6-bisphosphatase

questions.text: Which of the following is not metabolized in our body?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Sucrose

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sucrose is not metabolized if injected intravenously and will be excreted in the urine.

questions.text: Assertion : Patient of aldolase B deficiency was seen in the OPD. Feeding of fructose will cause hypoglycemia in the patient. Reason : Fructose 1-phosphate inhibits liver phosphorylase.

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

questions.correct_answer: A. A and R both correct and R is explanation of A
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In aldolase B deficiency , fructose metabolism leads to the accumulation of fructose-1-phosphate , which inhibits glycogen phosphorylase , causing hypoglycemia.
  • ➤ aldolase B deficiency
  • ➤ fructose-1-phosphate
  • ➤ glycogen phosphorylase

questions.text: Which of the following enzymes are involved in gluconeogenesis? Pyruvate kinase PEP Carboxykinase Pyruvate carboxylase Glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) 2, 3, 4

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Key enzymes in gluconeogenesis include PEP Carboxykinase, Pyruvate carboxylase, and Glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase, while Pyruvate kinase is specific to glycolysis.

questions.text: Assertion : Inulin-like fructans are used as probiotics as they are non-digestible. Reason : Resistance to digestion in the upper GI tract results from the beta configuration of anomeric C2.

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) A wrong

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objectives:
  • ➤ Inulin-like fructans are prebiotics , not probiotics, and their resistance to digestion is due to the beta configuration at the anomeric C2 .
  • ➤ prebiotics
  • ➤ beta configuration at the anomeric C2

questions.text: A fifty-year-old man with type 1 diabetes is referred to an ophthalmologist for evaluation of developing cataract. Which of the following enzymes is most strongly associated with cataract formation in this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Aldose reductase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aldose reductase is the enzyme most strongly associated with the development of cataracts in patients with diabetes, as it converts glucose into sorbitol, which accumulates in the lens.
  • ➤ Aldose reductase

questions.text: Production of fructose in seminal fluid is:

options.label: B
options.text: Glucose 6 PO 4 → Sorbitol PO 4 → fructose PO 4 → fructose

questions.correct_answer: C. Glucose 6 PO 4 → glucose → Sorbitol → fructose
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Glucose 6 PO4 → glucose → Sorbitol → fructose

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fructose is produced in seminal fluid through the sorbitol pathway , where glucose is first converted into sorbitol and then into fructose .
  • ➤ sorbitol pathway
  • ➤ glucose
  • ➤ sorbitol
  • ➤ fructose

questions.text: A young man finds that every time he eats dairy products, he feels very uncomfortable. His stomach becomes distended. He develops gas and diarrhea frequently. These symptoms do not appear when he eats food other than dairy products. Which of the following is most likely enzyme in which this young man is deficient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Beta galactosidase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A deficiency in beta galactosidase (lactase) leads to lactose intolerance, resulting in gastrointestinal symptoms when consuming dairy products.
  • ➤ beta galactosidase (lactase)

questions.text: In the figure below, which letter designates a reaction that may be catalyzed by different enzymes in different tissues, playing an important role in regulation of serum glucose levels?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Letter A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The reaction of glucose to glucose-6-phosphate (labeled A ) is catalyzed by different enzymes, hexokinase and glucokinase , in various tissues, playing an important role in the regulation of serum glucose levels.
  • ➤ A
  • ➤ hexokinase
  • ➤ glucokinase

questions.text: Which reaction in the figure below occurs in both muscle and liver but has substantially different qualities in the two?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Reaction B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The conversion of glucose to glucose-6-phosphate occurs in both liver and muscle, but the enzymes involved, glucokinase and hexokinase , differ in their regulatory properties.
  • ➤ conversion of glucose to glucose-6-phosphate
  • ➤ glucokinase
  • ➤ hexokinase

questions.text: A person on a fat-free carbohydrate-rich diet continues to grow obese. Which of the following lipoproteins is likely to be elevated?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) VLDL

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ VLDL transports endogenous triglycerides produced from excess carbohydrates, leading to elevated levels in a person on a carbohydrate-rich diet.
  • ➤ VLDL

questions.text: Which of the following is an activator of LCAT?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Apo AI

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Apo AI is the primary activator of LCAT , which is essential for the maturation of HDL particles.
  • ➤ Apo AI
  • ➤ LCAT

questions.text: Which of the following processes yields arachidonic acid in mammals?

options.label: B
options.text: Chain elongation and one desaturation of linolenic acid

options.label: C
options.text: Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid

questions.correct_answer: C. Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Chain elongation and two desaturations of linoleic acid

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Arachidonic acid is produced from linoleic acid by chain elongation and two desaturations , which is crucial for omega-6 fatty acid metabolism.
  • ➤ linoleic acid
  • ➤ chain elongation and two desaturations

questions.text: Enzyme for cholesterol synthesis and ketone body synthesis?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) HMG CoA synthase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ HMG CoA synthase is the key enzyme for both cholesterol synthesis and ketone body synthesis .
  • ➤ HMG CoA synthase
  • ➤ cholesterol synthesis
  • ➤ ketone body synthesis

questions.text: In beta oxidation of palmitic acid, if the final product is acetoacetate, what is the net gain of ATP?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) 26

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The net gain of ATP from beta oxidation of palmitic acid with acetoacetate as the final product is 26 ATP .
  • ➤ palmitic acid
  • ➤ 26 ATP

questions.text: Assertion : When the liver is actively synthesizing fatty acids in fed state, there is a concomitant decrease in β oxidation of fatty acids inside the mitochondria. Reason : Malonyl CoA inhibits CPT-1, present at the outer mitochondrial membrane.

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

questions.correct_answer: A. A and R both correct and R is explanation of A
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ During fatty acid synthesis in the liver, malonyl CoA inhibits CPT-1 , leading to a decrease in β-oxidation of fatty acids.
  • ➤ malonyl CoA
  • ➤ CPT-1
  • ➤ β-oxidation

questions.text: Assertion: Acetoacetate, Beta hydroxybutyrate, and Acetone are compounds termed as ketone bodies. The liver is an organ that can synthesize ketone bodies but cannot utilize them. Reason: All enzymes for ketone body synthesis are present in liver mitochondria.

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

questions.correct_answer: B. A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ While the liver synthesizes ketone bodies, it cannot utilize them due to the absence of thiophorase , even though all enzymes for synthesis are present in liver mitochondria.
  • ➤ liver
  • ➤ thiophorase

questions.text: In which type of hypertriglyceridemia are chylomicrons and VLDL remnants increased?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) III

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In Type III hyperlipoproteinemia , both chylomicrons and VLDL remnants are elevated due to defective clearance, leading to hypertriglyceridemia.
  • ➤ Type III hyperlipoproteinemia
  • ➤ chylomicrons
  • ➤ VLDL remnants

questions.text: Niemann-Pick disease, like other neurolipidoses, presents in infancy or childhood with plateauing of development and neurologic regression. The accumulating substance is a phospholipid made in which of the following steps in the figure below?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Step C

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Sphingomyelin accumulates in Niemann-Pick disease due to a deficiency in sphingomyelinase , and its synthesis occurs at Step C in the pathway.
  • ➤ Sphingomyelin
  • ➤ Niemann-Pick disease
  • ➤ sphingomyelinase
  • ➤ Step C

questions.text: For each item listed below, select the appropriate location from the drawing shown above:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) HMG – CoA lyase – B

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Carnitine shuttle involves enzymes located in both the outer and inner mitochondrial membranes, with CPT1 located in the outer mitochondrial membrane. F0F1 ATP synthase is part of the inner mitochondrial membrane, while HMG-CoA lyase operates in the mitochondrial matrix.
  • ➤ Carnitine shuttle
  • ➤ CPT1
  • ➤ F0F1 ATP synthase
  • ➤ HMG-CoA lyase

questions.text: After overnight fasting, levels of glucose transporters reduced in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Adipocytes

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ After overnight fasting, insulin-dependent glucose transporters like GLUT-4 are reduced, specifically in adipocytes and muscle , leading to decreased glucose uptake in these tissues.
  • ➤ insulin-dependent glucose transporters
  • ➤ adipocytes and muscle

questions.text: PKU is a congenital amino acid metabolic disorder. In one of the following rare variants of PKU, the enzyme deficient is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Dihydro pterin Reductase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the rare variant of PKU , the enzyme Dihydro pterin Reductase is deficient, leading to an inability to regenerate BH4, which is necessary for the function of Phenylalanine Hydroxylase.
  • ➤ rare variant of PKU
  • ➤ Dihydro pterin Reductase

questions.text: Messenger RNA can be purified by:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Affinity chromatography

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ mRNA can be purified using Affinity chromatography due to its affinity for nucleotide sequences .
  • ➤ Affinity chromatography
  • ➤ affinity for nucleotide sequences

questions.text: Phosphorylation occurs in all the following except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Asparagine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Phosphorylation occurs on amino acids with hydroxyl groups, such as Serine, Threonine, and Tyrosine , but not on Asparagine , which lacks this functional group.
  • ➤ Serine, Threonine, and Tyrosine
  • ➤ Asparagine

questions.text: Which of the following is a powerful qualitative and quantitative technique to assess molecular mass and primary amino acid sequence of peptides and proteins?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Mass spectrometry

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Mass spectrometry is the best method for determining the molecular mass and primary amino acid sequence of proteins.
  • ➤ Mass spectrometry

questions.text: Which of the following technique is not used to determine molecular weight of protein:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Thin layer chromatography

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thin layer chromatography is not used for determining the molecular weight of proteins, whereas methods like gel filtration , SDS-PAGE , and sucrose density gradient centrifuge are commonly used for that purpose.
  • ➤ Thin layer chromatography
  • ➤ gel filtration
  • ➤ SDS-PAGE
  • ➤ sucrose density gradient centrifuge

questions.text: Histamine is produced from histidine by decarboxylation. The cofactor is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Vitamin B6

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Vitamin B6 (pyridoxal phosphate) is the required cofactor for histidine decarboxylase , the enzyme responsible for converting histidine to histamine .
  • ➤ Vitamin B6
  • ➤ histidine decarboxylase
  • ➤ histidine
  • ➤ histamine

questions.text: Regulatory protein interact with DNA by all interaction except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Covalent Bond

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Regulatory proteins interact with DNA via hydrogen bonds , ionic bonds , and Van der Waals interactions , but not through covalent bonds , which would prevent the reversible nature of protein-DNA interactions.
  • ➤ hydrogen bonds
  • ➤ ionic bonds
  • ➤ Van der Waals interactions
  • ➤ covalent bonds

questions.text: Enzyme substrate interaction is mediated by all except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Van der Waals interaction

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Enzyme-substrate interactions are mediated primarily by hydrogen bonds , ionic bonds , and hydrophobic interactions , with Van der Waals interactions being less significant.
  • ➤ hydrogen bonds
  • ➤ ionic bonds
  • ➤ hydrophobic interactions
  • ➤ Van der Waals interactions

questions.text: Which one of the following is a cofactor and not a coenzyme?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Copper

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Copper is a cofactor , specifically a metal ion, and does not function as a coenzyme.
  • ➤ Copper
  • ➤ cofactor

questions.text: All of the following are true about DNA polymerase except:

options.label: C
options.text: DNA G protein has primase activity in E. Coli

options.label: D
options.text: DNA polymerase two has no proofreading

questions.correct_answer: D. DNA polymerase two has no proofreading
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) DNA polymerase two has no proofreading

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ DNA polymerase 2 has proofreading ability . The statement claiming it lacks this function is incorrect, while Alpha and Beta polymerases lack proofreading.
  • ➤ DNA polymerase 2
  • ➤ proofreading ability

questions.text: How do Di-Deoxy nucleotides (e.g., 2’3’ dideoxy ATP) inhibit viral DNA replication by reverse transcriptase?

options.label: A
options.text: The analog becomes covalently bound to the enzyme and inhibits it

options.label: B
options.text: There is no 3’ Hydroxyl group to form the next phosphodiester bond

options.label: C
options.text: The analog can/t hydrogen bond to DNA template

options.label: D
options.text: Incorporation of the analog initiates rapid degradation of newly synthesized strand

questions.correct_answer: B. There is no 3’ Hydroxyl group to form the next phosphodiester bond
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) There is no 3’ Hydroxyl group to form the next phosphodiester bond

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Di-Deoxy nucleotides inhibit viral DNA replication by preventing phosphodiester bond formation due to the absence of the 3' hydroxyl group.
  • ➤ preventing phosphodiester bond formation

questions.text: Apo B48, B100 belong to the same RNA, difference between them is due to:

options.label: B
options.text: Chemical changes in mRNA after splicing

questions.correct_answer: B. Chemical changes in mRNA after splicing
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Chemical changes in mRNA after splicing

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The difference between Apo B48 and Apo B100 is due to RNA editing , specifically the chemical modification of mRNA after splicing.
  • ➤ Apo B48
  • ➤ Apo B100
  • ➤ RNA editing
  • ➤ chemical modification

questions.text: The base sequence of the strand of DNA used as the template for transcription has the base sequence GATCTAC. What is the base sequence of RNA product?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) GUAGAUC

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Transcription produces RNA that is complementary to the DNA template strand, with uracil (U) replacing thymine (T) .
  • ➤ uracil (U)
  • ➤ thymine (T)

questions.text: A tRNA molecule that is supposed to carry cysteine (tRNA cys ) is mischarged, so that it carries alanine (ala-tRNA cys ). Assuming no correction occurs, what will be the fate of this alanine residue during protein synthesis?

options.label: A
options.text: It will be incorporated into a protein in response to an alanine codon.

options.label: B
options.text: It will be incorporated into a protein in response to a cysteine codon.

options.label: C
options.text: It will remain attached to the tRNA. as it cannot be used for protein synthesis.

options.label: D
options.text: It will be chemically convened to cysteine by cellular enzymes.

questions.correct_answer: B. It will be incorporated into a protein in response to a cysteine codon.
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) It will be incorporated into a protein in response to a cysteine codon.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The ribosome recognizes the anticodon of the tRNA during protein synthesis, not the amino acid attached to it. Misincorporation of alanine will occur at positions where cysteine is encoded if tRNA cys is mischarged with alanine.

questions.text: In the genetic code of human nuclear DNA, one of the codons specifying the amino acid tyrosine is UAC. Another codon specifying the same amino acid is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) UAU

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The two codons for tyrosine are UAC and UAU, which share the same first two nucleotides (UA).

questions.text: Assertion : Fidelity of protein translation depends upon Aminoacyl tRNA Synthetase. Reason : Aminoacyl tRNA Synthetase has proofreading ability.

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

questions.correct_answer: A. A and R both correct and R is explanation of A
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Aminoacyl-tRNA synthetase ensures the fidelity of protein translation by correctly attaching amino acids to their respective tRNAs and employing proofreading to correct any errors.

questions.text: Initiation codon in Lac I is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) GUG

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The initiation codon for the lac I gene in the lac operon is GUG , not the typical AUG.
  • ➤ GUG

questions.text: Assertion : The hydrolytic step leading to the release of a polypeptide chain from a ribosome is catalyzed by Release factors. Reason : Release factors recognize Stop codons.

options.label: A
options.text: A and R both correct and R is explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: A and R both correct but R is not explanation of A

questions.explanation:
Ans. C) A wrong

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Peptidyl transferase catalyzes the release of the polypeptide chain, while release factors recognize stop codons and activate this process.

questions.text: Restriction fragment length polymorphism analysis can only be used to follow the inheritance of a genetic disease if:

options.label: A
options.text: mRNA probe is used in combination with antibodies

options.label: B
options.text: The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to an restriction site

options.label: C
options.text: Mutation is outside of restriction sites so that cleaving still occurs

options.label: D
options.text: Restriction fragments remain the same size but their charge changes

questions.correct_answer: B. The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to an restriction site
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) The disease-causing mutation is at or closely linked to a restriction site

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ RFLP analysis can detect mutations that affect restriction sites, allowing for the tracking of disease-causing mutations linked to those sites.

questions.text: Mitochondrial DNA true is:

options.label: B
options.text: On lagging strand Okazaki Fragments are synthesized as RNA

options.label: C
options.text: Primer is excised in much the same way as the primers in the nucleus

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) All of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gamma polymerase mediates mitochondrial DNA replication, and the processes on the lagging strand, including Okazaki fragment synthesis and primer excision, are similar to nuclear DNA.

questions.text: Gluconeogenesis (pyruvate to glucose) requires:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) 4 ATP, 2 GTP, 2 NADH

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Gluconeogenesis requires 4 ATP, 2 GTP, and 2 NADH molecules (11 ATP) to convert pyruvate into glucose and 7 ATP consumed to convert glucose to pyruvate

questions.text: Which one of the following statements concerning glycolysis is correct?

options.label: A
options.text: Heokinase is important in hepatic glucose metabolism only in the absorptive period following consumption of a carbohydrate-containing meal.

options.label: B
options.text: Fructose 2.6-Bisphosphate is a potent inhibitor of phosphofructokinase.

options.label: C
options.text: The regulated reactions are also the irreversible reactions.

options.label: D
options.text: The conversion of glucose to lactate yields two ATP and two NADH.

questions.correct_answer: C. The regulated reactions are also the irreversible reactions.
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) The regulated reactions are also the irreversible reactions.

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The regulated reactions in glycolysis are the irreversible reactions, which are key control points in the pathway.

questions.text: A baby presented with convulsions due to B6 deficiency. A test to identify vitamin B6 deficiency is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Xanthurenic acid test

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The xanthurenic acid test is the most appropriate test for diagnosing vitamin B6 deficiency, as it detects elevated xanthurenic acid levels in the urine.
  • ➤ xanthurenic acid test

questions.text: A patient presented with a triad of angular stomatitis, corneal vascularization, and glossitis with a magenta-colored tongue. This is probably a case of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Riboflavin deficiency

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The triad of angular stomatitis, corneal vascularization, and glossitis with a magenta-colored tongue strongly suggests riboflavin deficiency.

questions.text: Which of the following is an incorrect pair of amino acid and product?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Histidine: GABA

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Histidine is converted into histamine, not GABA. GABA is synthesized from glutamate.

questions.text: Which of the following enzymes can use both NAD and NADP?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) Glutamate dehydrogenase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Glutamate dehydrogenase is distinct in its ability to utilize both NAD and NADP as cofactors during its catalytic function.

questions.text: Which of the following amino acids is not formed by post-translational modification?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Selenocysteine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Selenocysteine is incorporated during translation, not through post-translational modification, making it unique compared to the other amino acids listed.

questions.text: Barth syndrome is a cardiomyopathy caused by defective cardiolipin synthesis; a lipid present in membranes of?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Mitochondria

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cardiolipin is a lipid found in the inner mitochondrial membrane, and defects in its synthesis lead to Barth syndrome, a form of cardiomyopathy.

questions.text: A child presents with pancytopenia, neck rigidity, hypertonia, and fatal bronchopneumonia. Bone marrow biopsy results show a 'crumbled tissue paper appearance' due to the accumulation of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Glucocerebroside

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The 'crumbled tissue paper appearance' is due to the accumulation of glucocerebroside , characteristic of Gaucher disease.
  • ➤ glucocerebroside

questions.text: Hormone-sensitive lipase is inhibited by:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Insulin

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Insulin inhibits hormone-sensitive lipase, preventing the breakdown of stored fats and promoting fat storage in adipose tissue.

questions.text: Low insulin: Glucagon ratio favors:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Gluconeogenesis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A low insulin: glucagon ratio favors gluconeogenesis, the process of generating glucose from non-carbohydrate sources.

questions.text: Because of the close interrelationship between the vitamins, patients with deficiencies of either folate or vitamin B12 exhibit similar symptoms. Which of the following tests would best help distinguish between a folate and vitamin B12 deficiency?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Blood level of methylmalonate

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The blood level of methylmalonate is elevated in vitamin B12 deficiency and can help distinguish it from folate deficiency.

questions.text: Tryptophan is:

options.label: B
options.text: Polar, essential and both glucogenic & ketogenic

questions.correct_answer: D. Nonpolar, essential, both glucogenic & ketogenic
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Nonpolar, essential, both glucogenic & ketogenic

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tryptophan is a nonpolar, essential amino acid that is both glucogenic and ketogenic.

questions.text: Which of the following codons does not show degeneracy?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Methionine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Methionine, coded by a single codon AUG, does not show degeneracy.

questions.text: Orotic acid:

options.label: A
options.text: Reacts with PRPP to form OMP

options.label: C
options.text: Can be converted to UMP and CMP

questions.explanation:
Ans. D) All of the above

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Orotic acid plays a critical role in pyrimidine synthesis by reacting with PRPP and being converted into UMP and CMP.

questions.text: A child with a large head, multiple fractures, and blue scleras (whites of the eyes) is evaluated for osteogenesis imperfecta. One study involves labeling of collagen chains in tissue culture to assess their mobility by gel electrophoresis. Amino acids labeled with radioactive carbon 14 are added to the culture dishes in order to label collagen. Which of the following amino acids would not result in labeled collagen?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Hydroxyproline

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hydroxyproline is not incorporated during protein synthesis but is formed post-translationally from proline, so it would not be labeled in this experiment.

questions.text: A 23-year-old lady has elevated BP on her routine checkup at 8 months gestation, and testing by her obstetrician demonstrates anemia with hemolysis, elevated liver enzymes, and low platelets that are characteristic of HELLP syndrome. The female is hospitalized and fetal maturity tests are performed that allow elective premature delivery. The female quickly recovers, but the premature newborn has a dilated heart and elevated liver enzymes that are characteristic of a defect in long-chain fatty acid oxidation. The potential enzyme deficiencies are those responsible for the sequential oxidation of fatty acids, which include which of the following?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Dehydrogenase, hydratase, dehydrogenase, thiolase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The sequential oxidation of fatty acids involves the enzymes dehydrogenase, hydratase, dehydrogenase, and thiolase.

questions.text: A 4-year-old boy of Middle Eastern ancestry is known to have inherited favism, a sensitivity to fava beans due to glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency (MIM305900). Which of the following indicates the primary pathway affected by this deficiency and the pathway secondarily affected because one of its energy substrates will be deficient?

options.label: A
options.text: Pentose phosphate pathway, fatty acid synthesis

options.label: B
options.text: Pentose phosphate pathway, fatty acid oxidation

options.label: C
options.text: Citric acid cycle, pentose phosphate pathway

questions.correct_answer: A. Pentose phosphate pathway, fatty acid synthesis
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Pentose phosphate pathway, fatty acid synthesis

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Glucose-6-phosphate dehydrogenase deficiency affects the pentose phosphate pathway, leading to a reduction in NADPH, which is required for fatty acid synthesis.

questions.text: Which of the following amino acids cannot participate in transamination?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Lysine, along with Proline and Threonine, cannot undergo transamination due to their structural properties.

questions.text: Tangier disease is autosomal recessive disease characterized by orange tonsil and low HDL. It is due to mutation in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tangier disease is caused by a mutation in the ABCA1 gene, leading to low HDL levels and characteristic orange tonsils.
  • ➤ ABCA1

questions.text: Increased level of lipoprotein (a) predispose to:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Increased levels of lipoprotein (a) are strongly associated with an elevated risk of atherosclerosis , making it a key factor in cardiovascular disease development.
  • ➤ atherosclerosis

questions.text: A child is presented with hypoglycemia, hepatomegaly, and accumulation of branched glycogen called limit dextrin. The most probable diagnosis is:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Cori’s disease, also known as limit dextrinosis, is characterized by the accumulation of branched glycogen (limit dextrins) due to a deficiency in the debranching enzyme.

questions.text: All the following are used in the TCA cycle except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ NADP is not used in the TCA cycle, while NAD, FAD, and GDP are essential components of the cycle.

questions.text: Hyperammonemia is toxic to the brain by decreasing the following substrate of the TCA cycle:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hyperammonemia leads to the depletion of α-ketoglutarate in the brain, disrupting the TCA cycle and contributing to ammonia toxicity.
  • ➤ α-ketoglutarate

questions.text: A 33-year-old man presents with symptoms of weakness, fatigue, shortness of breath, and dizziness. His hemoglobin level is less than 7 g/dL (normal for a male is greater than 13.5 g/dL). Red blood cells isolated from the patient show abnormally low levels of lactate production. A deficiency of which one of the following enzymes is the most likely cause of this patient's anemia?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Pyruvate kinase

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pyruvate kinase deficiency in red blood cells impairs ATP and lactate production, leading to hemolytic anemia due to increased red blood cell fragility.

questions.text: Ochronosis occurs due to accumulation of?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ochronosis occurs due to the accumulation of homogentisic acid in connective tissues, often seen in patients with alkaptonuria.
  • ➤ homogentisic acid

questions.text: Identify the type of enzyme inhibition:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Competitive

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In competitive inhibition, the inhibitor increases Km while Vmax remains unchanged, as demonstrated by the intersecting lines on the y-axis in the Lineweaver-Burk plot.

questions.text: Keshan disease is a disease caused by the deficiency of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Keshan disease is caused by a selenium deficiency and is associated with cardiomyopathy.
  • ➤ selenium

questions.text: One important function of nitric oxide (NO) is the induction of vascular smooth muscle relaxation in response to acetylcholine. The production of NO requires which amino acid?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Arginine is the amino acid required for the production of nitric oxide, which plays a key role in vascular smooth muscle relaxation.
  • ➤ Arginine

questions.text: A double-stranded DNA genome isolated from a bacteria was found to contain 15% thymine. What is the percentage of guanine in this genome?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In a double-stranded DNA molecule, the percentages of adenine and thymine are equal, as are the percentages of guanine and cytosine. If thymine is 15%, guanine will be 35%.

questions.text: Klenow fragment of prokaryotic DNA polymerase is:

options.label: A
options.text: Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

options.label: B
options.text: Large fragment of DNA Polymerase III, that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

options.label: C
options.text: Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' exonuclease, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' polymerase activity of intact DNA polymerase I.

questions.correct_answer: A. Large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' polymerase, 3'→5' exonuclease lacks the 5'→3' exonuclease activity of intact DNA polymerase I.
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Klenow fragment is the large fragment of DNA Polymerase I that retains its 5'→3' polymerase and 3'→5' exonuclease activities but lacks 5'→3' exonuclease activity.

questions.text: Post-transcriptional modification includes all of the following except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Ubiquitination is not a post-transcriptional modification but is involved in protein degradation, unlike the other options listed.
  • ➤ Ubiquitination

questions.text: A young patient with a history of recurring attacks of pancreatitis, eruptive xanthomas, normal cholesterol, and increased plasma triglyceride levels (1500 mg/dl) associated with chylomicrons, most likely has a deficiency in:
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A deficiency in lipoprotein lipase leads to the accumulation of chylomicrons, causing hypertriglyceridemia, pancreatitis, and eruptive xanthomas.
  • ➤ lipoprotein lipase

questions.text: Glycine is not required in the synthesis of:
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Glycine is required for the synthesis of heme , purines , and collagen , but not for pyrimidines .
  • ➤ heme
  • ➤ purines
  • ➤ collagen
  • ➤ pyrimidines

questions.text: A mother has brought her 3-month-old baby to the pediatrician and indicates that the infant is lethargic and has poor suckling and seems uninterested in eating. In addition, the mother notes that the baby’s diapers often smell like burnt sugar. This infant likely has a defect in which of the following enzymes?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Maple syrup urine disease is caused by a deficiency in branched-chain alpha-keto dehydrogenase , leading to the accumulation of branched-chain amino acids and the characteristic burnt sugar odor in the urine.
  • ➤ branched-chain alpha-keto dehydrogenase

questions.text: A 20-year-old anemic man was found to have an abnormal form of beta-globin chain that is 172 amino acids long rather than the 141 found in normal protein. Which of the following point mutations is consistent with this abnormality?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The mutation UAA → CAA eliminates the stop codon, allowing the beta-globin chain to extend beyond its normal length, resulting in a protein that is 172 amino acids long.
  • ➤ UAA → CAA

questions.text: The reaction: succinyl CoA + acetoacetate → Acetoacetyl CoA + succinate occurs in all of the following except:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The liver synthesizes ketone bodies but does not utilize them, as it lacks the enzyme thiophorase , which is essential for the conversion of ketone bodies into energy.
  • ➤ thiophorase

questions.text: A culture of E.coli is grown in a medium containing glucose and lactose. The expression of the lactose operon over time in the cells is shown in the graph below. Which statement best describes the change that occurred at point A?

options.label: A
options.text: Lactose was added to the culture

options.label: B
options.text: cAMP concentration increased in the cells

options.label: C
options.text: Glucose was added to the culture

options.label: D
options.text: Repressor protein dissociated from the operator

questions.correct_answer: B. cAMP concentration increased in the cells
questions.explanation:
Ans. B) cAMP concentration increased in the cells

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ In the presence of lactose, E. coli only expresses the lactose operon when glucose is absent, due to increased cAMP levels, which activate the operon.

questions.text: Which of the following amino acids is not formed after post-translational modification?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A) Selenocysteine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Selenocysteine is directly incorporated during translation, unlike other modified amino acids that arise through post-translational modifications.

questions.text: Identify the marked bond:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Hydrogen bonds are responsible for stabilizing the DNA double helix by connecting complementary nitrogenous bases.
  • ➤ Hydrogen bonds

questions.text: The attachment of Eukaryotic mRNA to the ribosome is mediated through:
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The 7-methylguanosine cap at the 5' end of eukaryotic mRNA mediates its attachment to the ribosome for the initiation of protein synthesis.
  • ➤ 7-methylguanosine cap

questions.text: A patient with thiamine deficiency develops lactic acidosis. Which of the following enzymes is affected?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thiamine deficiency affects pyruvate dehydrogenase , leading to lactic acidosis due to the accumulation of pyruvate and its conversion to lactate.
  • ➤ pyruvate dehydrogenase

questions.text: Which of the following would have no effect on the function of the protein product?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ A substitution of glutamine with asparagine is unlikely to affect protein function due to their similar properties.

questions.text: Wobble hypothesis explains which of the following concepts of the genetic code?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The wobble hypothesis explains how degeneracy in the genetic code allows multiple codons to code for the same amino acid.
  • ➤ wobble hypothesis

questions.text: Which among the following serves as cofactor for Glycogen phosphorylase?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Pyridoxal phosphate (Vitamin B6) is the essential cofactor for glycogen phosphorylase.
  • ➤ Pyridoxal phosphate (Vitamin B6)

questions.text: Thiamine deficiency results in decreased energy production, because TPP _______:

options.label: C
options.text: Is coenzyme for pyruvate and alpha-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase

options.label: D
options.text: Interferes with energy production from amino acids

questions.correct_answer: C. Is coenzyme for pyruvate and alpha-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Thiamine deficiency results in decreased energy production because TPP is a coenzyme for pyruvate dehydrogenase and alpha-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase , enzymes critical for energy generation in the citric acid cycle.
  • ➤ TPP is a coenzyme for pyruvate dehydrogenase and alpha-ketoglutarate dehydrogenase

questions.text: Which of the following can alter the gene expression by methylation and acetylation but not change the gene sequence?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Epigenetics modifies gene expression through mechanisms like methylation and acetylation without changing the DNA sequence.
  • ➤ Epigenetics

questions.text: An infant presented to the OPD with a history of vomiting and poor feeding. Musty odor is present in the baby's sweat and urine. Guthrie test was done and it was found to be positive. All are true regarding this disease except:

options.label: B
options.text: White patch of hair due to tryptophan deficiency

questions.correct_answer: B. White patch of hair due to tryptophan deficiency
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ PKU is caused by a phenylalanine hydroxylase enzyme defect , leading to the accumulation of phenylacetate in the urine and, if untreated, results in mental retardation. Tryptophan deficiency and white hair patches are unrelated to this condition.
  • ➤ phenylalanine hydroxylase enzyme defect

questions.text: Which of the following is the best screening investigation for metabolic disorders?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Tandem mass spectrometry is the most effective method for screening metabolic disorders due to its ability to detect multiple conditions in a single test.
  • ➤ Tandem mass spectrometry

questions.text: Fluoroacetate is a component of pesticides. Which of the following metabolic pathways is inhibited by this compound?
questions.explanation:
Ans. A)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Fluoroacetate inhibits the TCA cycle by forming fluoro citrate, which blocks aconitase and halts energy production.
  • ➤ TCA cycle

questions.text: Child presents with hypotonia and seizures. It was confirmed to be Zellweger syndrome. Which among the following accumulates in the brain in this condition?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Zellweger syndrome is characterized by the accumulation of very long chain fatty acids (VLCFAs) due to defective peroxisomes.
  • ➤ accumulation of very long chain fatty acids (VLCFAs)

questions.text: A bodybuilder starts eating raw eggs for protein. He starts to develop fatigue on moderate exercise. The doctor prescribes a vitamin. Which enzyme is deficient in him?
questions.explanation:
Ans. B)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Biotin deficiency due to the consumption of raw eggs can lead to impaired activity of pyruvate carboxylase , causing fatigue during moderate exercise.
  • ➤ Biotin deficiency
  • ➤ pyruvate carboxylase

questions.text: Which of the following TCA cycle intermediates is a part of heme metabolism?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C) Succinyl CoA + glycine

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Succinyl CoA from the TCA cycle is essential for heme metabolism, serving as a precursor in the synthesis of delta-aminolevulinic acid (ALA), the first step in heme production.
  • ➤ Succinyl CoA

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about proteoglycans?

options.label: C
options.text: Made of amino acids and sugars

questions.explanation:
Ans. D)

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Proteoglycans absorb large amounts of water to form a hydrated gel, which is crucial for their function in tissues.
